channel.title: Interface Editor, saves to cache file, only one clientside edit required
channel.description:
To stop all hardcoding and "Interface Makers" such as Lin his that just generate crappy hardocoded shit i release this to the MoparScape Community: [B][URL=http://uppit.com/DBRJD1]Download here [JAR, Source And all files)] [/URL]
New stuff is: Automated window frame generation in 508 and 317 style(For 508 style, you need to move the bar manually) [s]New engine sprite support(use ne_<spriteid>)[/s] ( You have to implement it yourself clientside) Swing UI ;-) CS1 Editing inside the application
Usage info: When you click an create button, drag the mouse from the position till the size is correct Inventory sizes arent in pixels but in items
[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/ok64vt.jpg[/img][/B]

item.title: Interface Editor, saves to cache file, only one clientside edit required
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:15, topic:289094”][quote author=pkdenni link=topic=382184.msg3236661#msg3236661 date=1276537300]
so uhh how does this work??
[/quote]

This topic is a year old… :|, you open it by clicking the jar file??

Oh by the way, hamachi sucks, just portforward. (Talking about your siggy)[/quote]

herp derp his post is from june why are you replying to it derp herp

Read full topic

item.title: Interface Editor, saves to cache file, only one clientside edit required
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:2, topic:289094”]You’re not going to stop anything. Personally I’d prefer to use this over my interface maker any day, but when I first downloaded it, it didn’t save anything and I looked at it as useless. The interface maker was made to help people who prefer to not use this, and to give me a project since I wanted a break from my server.

Oh and, way to make the window resizing lock up the program, and then my computer.[/quote]
Q.Q

Read full topic

item.title: Interface Editor, saves to cache file, only one clientside edit required
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

You’re not going to stop anything. Personally I’d prefer to use this over my interface maker any day, but when I first downloaded it, it didn’t save anything and I looked at it as useless. The interface maker was made to help people who prefer to not use this, and to give me a project since I wanted a break from my server.

Oh and, way to make the window resizing lock up the program, and then my computer.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @peterbjornx peterbjornx
item.description:
@peterbjornx wrote:

To stop all hardcoding and “Interface Makers” such as Lin his that just generate crappy hardocoded shit i release this to the MoparScape Community:
[B]Download here [JAR, Source And all files)]

New stuff is:
Automated window frame generation in 508 and 317 style(For 508 style, you need to move the bar manually)
New engine sprite support(use ne_) ( You have to implement it yourself clientside)
Swing UI
CS1 Editing inside the application

Usage info:
When you click an create button, drag the mouse from the position till the size is correct
Inventory sizes arent in pixels but in items

[/B]
